thread.title: UGA football quick hitters: Mark Richt tells team it 'can’t let one loss determine who Georgia football is'
thread.title_full: UGA football quick hitters: Mark Richt tells team it 'can’t let one loss determine who Georgia football is'

author: Marc Weiszer
title: UGA football quick hitters: Mark Richt tells team it 'can’t let one loss determine who Georgia football is'
text:
UGA backup Hunter Long at the ready again while Brandon Kublanow banged up 
Georgia defensive back Quincy Mauger recounted the message that came from coach Mark Richt to the team since the loss to Alabama like this: “You can’t let one loss determine who Georgia football is. You’ve got to keep fighting.” Players said they were moving on to focus on Tennessee. “We’re keeping our heads straight,” Sanders said. “We’re not going to let one loss bring us down. We’re going to maintain our work ethic.” 
…Georgia’s second road game of the season will have the home team wearing an alternate uniform again. Tennessee will debut “Smokey Grey” that feature grey helmets with a Smoky Mountains design. Coach Butch Jones announced what his team will wear “if we do get all the helmets in.” He said the change “does not help you win a football game, but I know everyone has been looking forward to that.” 
…Saturday's UGA captains: Nick Chubb, Sterling Bailey, Jordan Jenkins and Jake Ganus. 
...Tennessee receiver Pig Howard (concussion) is questionable, but receiver Marquez North (back) is on track to play. Starting guard Dylan Wiesman (foot) is expected to practice.
